title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [12 february 1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [12 February 1868]
text: 12 Feb. 1868WensdayWednesday 1 oclocko'clock O Walti have just got your letter i thought it was a goner but it has come all safe with the 2 dollerdollars i got the letter of last thursdayThursday Walter and the one i neglected to speak of of some time ago of a fridayFriday so i have not missed any the last weeksweek's one i liked its giving a description of how you spent your time) and i got the franklyn almanackFranklin Almanack but i have not got the papers you spoke offof to day but probably shall get them to morrow the carrier seems very Obliging i gave him the 50 ctscents for new year and last week i gave him 25 ctscents as he had brought me a number of books and the almanac its a real good one much better than the tribune one so i think i will make out for almanacksalmanacs this year mary hasenthasn't come yet the weather has been very bad indeed so i think she could not have got here last sundaySunday was awfull Edd went to church but had sencesense enoughfenough to come home before dark he fell twice but only wet him it didentdidn't hurt him i see in the eagle mondayMonday there was 7 women all down at once in orange st sundaySunday night came from BeechersBeecher's church it was very bad indeed toward evening who should come here but Emma pricePrice she said she come out from the clouds she came from mrs Wells sMrs. Wells's but she had a pretty bad time of it she missed her way and got way up to mrs blacksMrs. Black's so when she got here it was almost night she had on rubber boots but had gone over the tops in water so she took it off and dried her feet and had to go back she said mrs wellsMrs. Wells would be uneasy about her if she didentdidn't go back) i felt uneasy very after she went and i see how very bad it was but i suppose she got safe as i have not heard any thing her mother is not as well as she has been has spells of her old complainti have had two letters from Matt since the one i sent to you the first she seemed quite homesick the next she is quite contented they have got a house at last from the 1 of marchMarch 7 rooms for 65 dolledollars per month had to take it for two years or not have it matt says Jeff is glad they come he is very tired of hotellhotel life this house is out of the thick part of the city matt says the children is very much pleased the boarders makes very much of sis she tells them all about her grandma and her uncles she says they think the water dontdon't agree with them in the morning when they first get up they often all vomit at once she is very carefullcareful about their diet she says) George is to camdenCamden yet i dont think he will be home till the last of the month i went down Walt and got the money order cashed in a day or two after i recievedreceived it) i am feeling as well as usual) O i like to forgot matt says they got your letter and was so glad that you must write as often as you can and she will write to you so no more at present Walter dear) so youryou're writing again leaves of grassLeaves of Grass well if it dontdon't hurt you i am glad Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [12 February 1868]
